forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 46. Northeast wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.shortForecast: Partly Sunny then Light Rain Likely
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely after 4pm. Partly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. Southeast wind 6 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the evening drapes its soft cloak over Downtown San Francisco, a gentle haze settles into the night. The air is crisp, greeting you with a refreshing chill that hovers around 46 degrees, accompanied by a light breeze whispering from the northeast. Tonight's skies are only partially clad in clouds, allowing glimpses of celestial gems to peek through, inviting quiet contemplation as one gazes toward the horizon.

Upon the morrow, the landscape will shift as the seduction of rain creeps in, starting around four o’clock. A promising blend of partly sunny intervals will dance with clouds above, giving way to a forecast of cool temperatures slipping to around 57, as the southeast breeze carries anticipation of much-needed moisture. With a 70% chance of precipitation, it may be wise to prepare for a soft drizzle as the day unfolds—perfect for the sound of water gently meeting pavement, a crisp backdrop to any midday stroll.

In this atmospheric ballet of sun and shadow, layer your attire thoughtfully; a light jacket or scarf will ward off the chill, while boots could be companions, ready for puddles forming along city streets. Perhaps tomorrow, take a moment to stroll through one of the quieter parks, loose in thought, or find a cozy café where the aroma of freshly brewed coffee can blend with the gentle sounds of raindrops tapping against the window. Permit yourself this slice of urban grace, relishing the joy found in simplicity as the city breathes around you.
